column4: i asked about this earlier today, but i still haven't been able to get it working - ubuntu isn't recognizing an IDE hd of mine.  anybody have any clues on where to start?
i'm not sure
it's just ubuntu - it works in suse
i found the drive in /proc, so i guess there is some sort of driver
yeah, i'm loving ubuntu sooo much more
but if i do fdisk -l  i only get my sata drive
no, i know how to mount it, but i can't even find the /dev
if it's in fstab will ubuntu find the /dev?
yeah, it's /dev/hda in suse, but i can't even fdisk /dev/hda in ubuntu
yes - that could definitely be it... Many people have problems with SATA in kernel2.6/Debian (especially booting of a SATA)
damn - that's not good news

ide-scsi, scsi-emu is apparently bugged in 2.6, there are many bugreports on it the Debian mailing lists. In particular, the stock mkinitrd is buggy and will in some cases break access to your root partition when you're booting of SATA. However, booting of an IDE and mounting a SATA should be fine
thanks - i guess i could try that.
oh - so you are booting of the SATA? what happens?
but i guess my MBR will still be on the SATA, is there a way to change that?
yeah, i boot off of the SATA, and it boots fine (in Suse or ubuntu) but the /dev/hda doesn't show up in ubuntu
I am not sure... do you get kernel panic during boot because you cannot mount the root partition?
no, ubuntu / (root) is on the SATA. the ide is just a data drive that i dearly need
in that case, it's not the same problem I've in encountered...
i guess that's good news....maybe
one thing I had to do to fix SATA was to boot with apci=off, but I doubt that will help you
thanks, it won't hurt for me to try that
i was thinking of making initrd just to make sure the module is there, but i don't want to go thru that if it's likely that the ide module is already there
